Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on Rick Steve's recommendation. Great location by the Colosseum, not a bad price for central Rome. Hostess was pleasant and helpful. Breakfast could be better (simply croissant/pastry and coffee and juice) - adding some fruit and/or meats would be nice. The bed was a little hard for our liking. Overall, a hotel I can confidently recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel with a charming host...”
Reviews.Author: garza007
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Paba during a week long trip to Rome in March. The location was terrific -- short walk to the Colosseum, metro, and several markets/restaurants. After visiting the nearby Church of St. Peter in Chains, we found a park where we were able to purchase espressos and watch the locals. It was only a short 10 min walk from the hotel and we enjoyed returning several times during our trip to get away from the hustle & bustle of the traffic. The hotel was extremely clean and tasteful. The bed was a bit hard and the bathroom needed some updating but these were only minor issues. Alberta was a wonderful host. She provided many useful recommendations regarding local markets for supplies as well as restaurants. As we had an early morning flight back, she was kind enough to provide some instruction on how to prepare cappuccinos since we were leaving before she arrived in the morning. We did tire of the same simple breakfast each morning by the end of the week although it was always fresh. My only true concern was the noise from Via Cavour at night. There is a restaurant/bar close to the hotel entrance. Workers cleaning up around 1-2am would make quite a racket before they left. After two days, I purchased a set of ear plugs at the pharmacy next door which took care of the problem. Overall, I would strongly recommend this facility on the basis of the location, convenience, and attentive host.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central spotlessly clean small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mumof4Kent
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Rome staying at the Hotel Paba. What a find! Smallish room but with all amenities and spotlessly clean. Alberta is very pleasant and helpful, providing fresh milk on demand and plenty of information about the city. Basic breakfast of croissant, roll, yoghurt, jam, tea or coffee to eat in the room, but perfectly adequate. Mini-bar and air conditioning. On the second floor but there is a lift. Only downside is that the bed and pillows were rather hard, but excellent value and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kawonl
Reviews.Content: Reading all the recomandations, me and my boyfriend decided to stay at Hotel Paba and i'm glad we did. As mentioned in all the other reviews, the location is superb, Roberta was charming and helpful and evrything else was more than expected. The room was big and with air-con, the shower was specious and clean and at the end of a long day it felt like coming home (Roberta even turned on our air-con one evening before our arrival so that the room won't be cold when we return. She's really wonderful). What more can we say? Tell your friends, but only the ones you trust won't ruin the nice atmosphere at this lovely hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelloveto
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and our expectations were surpassed. My husband and I and our 21 month old daughter stayed with Alberta for 7 nights in November 2011. Alberta is so kind, professional and attentive that it makes you feel like you have someone looking out for you. She helped us find answers when we needed them and was always available to talk about our adventures of the day. Breakfast with fresh croissants were yummy. The location was fabulous - close to everything. The real reason to come back is stay with Alberta who makes sure your needs are met and you enjoy our stay. Thank you Alberta!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Paba from reviews right here on trip advisor. Alberta was wonderful we stayed 3 nights, Sept.27-29, before our cruise. You can't say enough for the location it was great we had 2 tours ond the rest we did with the map Alberta gave us and riding the Metro. Cash exchage right across the street that did not charge a commision. the room was large and very clean, the bed was great. We cannot wait to go back and stay again. The breakfast she brought in every morning was amazing. We knew we lucked out when our driver told us we could not be in a better location. Don't hesitate to book Hotel Paba you won't be sorry. She sent our travel agent an email with all details and also set up transportation to the port for us.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: Superb location. Very clean. Simple but tasty breakfast. Alberta, who runs it, is relaxed, unfussy and helpful. If you want a boutique hotel and to lounge around a glitzy foyer, then this is not the place for you. If, however, you want a practical and comfortable base from which to explore the city, it would be hard to imagine anywhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paba”
Reviews.Author: Marcia H
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Hotel Paba in Oct. 2011. What a wonderful boutique hotel. Very clean, good location and the staff was so friendly! Our stay included a continental breakfast that was fresh and delicious! We would definitely stay there again and I would recommend to my family and friends! Thanks Hotel Paba!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean Rooms, Hard Bed and Pillow”
Reviews.Author: tony r
Reviews.Content: Just back from two weeks in Italy. We stayed the first three nights at Hotel Paba. If your only concern is location, location, location, this place has it and at a budget rate by Rome standards anyway. Very convenient to the main sights. The rooms are spotless and bathrooms certainly adequate. Now for the CONS: we stayed in a room on the courtyard side and I have to warn all that the restaurant downstairs is noisy throughout the night until about 3am, moving tables, stacking chairs, staff conversing. Then it quiets until about 5am and starts up all over again. Coupled with the hardest mattress we slept on (and I sleep on a semi-firm at home - this one was very, very firm), and pillows with no give to them, equaled the worst sleep we had while in Italy. As another reviewer mentioned, breakfast was a spartan affair - a croissant, yogurt, juice, and coffee. Again, based on the remainder of our stay throughout southern Italy, this breakfast was lacking in portion and variety, plus there was no dining room. It is definitely a budget hotel. Next time we would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett5
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and small hotel (with only 7 rooms I think). The staff, especially Alberta, were fantastic. This is a small hotel on the second floor, lift, free wifi and just around the corner from the Colosseum. The location is amazing since Rome is a very walkable city. The metro is a couple minute walk from the hotel and just one stop away from the main Termini station. I highly recommend this hotel. It is very clean, nice large beds, refrigerator/mini-bar (pay) with a small bathroom. The a/c works great and you are served breakfast in you room when you are ready. This is a gem of a hotel in Rome and I had a fantastic time!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paba - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: caseybrem
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Paba based on online reviews. We stayed 2 nights in October 2011 prior to a Mediterranean cruise. The hotel is in an ideal location - walking distance to Colosseum, Forum, Victor Emmanuel Monument, Basilica of San Clemente and St. Peter in Chains Church. We also walked to Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps but that might be more walking than you would care for. I think the hotel is a great value for the accommodations and location. We had a room in the back which was very quiet. It was a double but there was an additional alcove with a bed so it could be used as a triple. The breakfast is served in your room shortly after a telephone call telling the staff that you're ready. It consisted of orange juice, coffee, rolls, yogurt and the best croissants I've ever tasted. Alberta was a great help in rescheduling our transfer to Civitavecchia for our cruise when a mass demonstration was scheduled for that day and we wanted to leave Rome earlier than first planned. She contacted Romecabs.com and was able to get an earlier pick up for us so we avoided any delays caused by the demonstrations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: erinash10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Paba for our honeymoon this October. We arrived early, and they were just finishing cleaning the room. Once the room was ready, there was a bottle of champagne welcoming us to the hotel. Very nice gesture. Also, because they knew it was our honeymoon, they gave us a room with a nice big bed. The room was clean, bathroom was small (very typical for Europe, so no big deal) A/C, free wifi, lift. From the outside the hotel is located on the second floor. It was quiet and comfortable and the hotel staff was very helpful. Breakfast was included, and the only thing I can be picky about this hotel, was the breakfast. It was brought to our room daily, which was great, but was very simple. A bun, a croissant, and a yogurt. I little more variety would be nice. The hotel is right around the corner from the Colosseum, and in walking distance to all major sights if you are used to walking places. The only place we didn't walk to the entire time was the Vatican and Appian Way. Very good hotel for a budget and a nice place to relax from the chaos that is Rome

Reviews.Title: “The best value hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Adventure_Debi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at recommendations from friend. Not a fancy place but extremely clean and well located down the block from the Colliseum. Breakfast is served in your room daily. Alberta is absolutely the best manager/owner. She WILL treat you well and will help you with any reservations or needed information. Warning - if you go in high season it is essential to book 6 or more months ahead of times. The word is out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CaroMR
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, great location! it is so cool to walk 2 min and see the coliseum right at your face!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela W
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely delighted with this hotel and, especially, with Alberta who is an extraordinary manager. With her delightful smile and energy, she foresaw our needs and helped us throughout our visit to Rome. The breakfast was great - fresh Danish every morning along with yogurt, orange juice, Capuccino!, and roll. The location is ideal for exploring the entire city, walking distance from Ancient Rome, very close to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. The rooms are large, comfortable, air conditioned , clean and quiet, which surprised us because Via Cavour is one of the main avenues in the city. Ask her about restaurants - she has great suggestions. Also the rooms have safes and hair dryers, which we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: schwartz225
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Hotel Paba which is conveniently located near the Coloseum and the Roman Forum. The hotel is located one the 2nd floor of a building on the busy Via Cavour with lots of restaurants and shops, and we found it with no problem. After arriving, Alberta showed us to our room and I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was big for European standards and the bathroom was huge compared to other places we have stayed. The bed was very firm, but again, I've found this to be the norm at most places. We even had a nice balcony looking down Via Cavour towards the Forum. For breakfast, we just called Alberta every morning and she would tell you what she had. She always had fresh pastries delivered every morning and this was offered with yogurt and juice and coffee. It was a good start to every morning. We walked by other four star hotels all over Rome but I just cant imagine paying more for a place, when you have a gem like Hotel Paba around, and a wonderful city to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MichaelK_80
Reviews.Content: Hotel Paba is a few rooms inside a big and old house in the very centre of Rome - it's only a few minutes walk from the Forums and Colloseum. The rooms are big, also the bathrooms, everything is in a good condition and very clear. The staff - Alberta is amazing woman that did everything for us to feel like a dear guest in this great city. Waiting to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING HOTEL - CONVENIENT LOCATION GREAT SERVICES”
Reviews.Author: KV33
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks in Italy and wanted to spend the last couple of days in Rome but didn't book a room before we left. We were scrambling to find a hotel and LUCKILY a room was open at Hotel Paba. Alberta was EXCEPTIONAL helpful when we called. She gave us directions and suggestions on how to get to the hotel from the train station. We we getting into Rome very late and she was able to accommodate that. She was up and waiting for us when we arrived with are MANY, MANY luggage’s. The room that my family and I stayed in was nice and clean. The bed was comfortable and the AC worked well. No trouble sleeping, great blinds on the windows. One morning we woke up and wasn't sure if it was day time yet since the room was so dark (I can't sleep with lights coming into the windows). Oh and the towls were so soft. She provides a free breakfast in your room, which I thought was awesome. The location was perfect!! It took us one day to get use to the buses and we were taking them all over town. There was a great restaurant right next door (Biccesteria that we ate at twice after long days of sightseeing. This hotel is center of most attractions. This may not be a 5 star hotel but if your looking for an a location in the center, close to transportation, and helpful management this is your place. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MNnortherner
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for our first trip to Rome. We booked the family room and comfortably fit 2 adults and 2 teens plus luggage. The room is so thoughtfully appointed with luggage racks and plenty of storage closets to organize belongings during your stay. The air conditioning worked well, and our kids enjoyed a little down time one evening before dinner watching the cable/satellite television in the room. The bathroom is very small, but has the essentials. Because the air conditioning was on we kept the bathroom door shut so did not hear the noise from the street and nearby restaurant while we slept. We slept very well, and the hotel was very quiet, in part because of the small size of the accommodations (less than 10 rooms). Each morning when you are ready for breakfast, you ring Alberta (or one of her staff if she is out of town for a day or two) and they bring a tray with continental breakfast -- croissants, bread, juice, cocoa, coffee. Basics to get your day started. We found it tied us over until we had a light snack mid-day and then a full dinner in the evenings. As other reviewers have noted, the real gem of this hotel is Alberta -- she was so responsive by email before our stay, arranging for airport transport (so nice to step out of the terminal at Ciampino and see the driver holding the sign with our name on it!), making restaurant recommendations and reservations for dinner. She and her staff are wonderful. Via Cavour is a busy street, without much charm, but step off a block and you have the character-filled streets of the Monti neighborhood full of cafes, churches and shops. Down the street you see the Forum, and around the corner you glimpse the Colosseum at the end of the narrow streets. We walked virtually everywhere to reach the classic sights of central and Ancient Rome. We even walked back to the hotel after visiting the Vatican. The day we went out to Ostia Antica, the metro station was conveniently located up the street a block at the Cavour station. I would certainly stay at the Hotel Paba if we return to Rome in the future, particularly if Alberta still graces the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: maple2004maple
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome early July for 3 days. I booked this hotel based on Rick Steves travel book. It's very close to Colosseum and walking to Tiber River took about 20 minutes after dinner. Alberto is very helpful. She helped us call taxi to Vatican and Borghese Gallery in the morning. The hotel has a bookshelf where you can find a lot of travel books about Rome and maps. They have about 8 or 9 rooms, so if you want to be there in summer and need more than one room, book early.

Reviews.Title: “I love Alberta and her hotel- they are both Italian gems”
Reviews.Author: JilgesAway
Reviews.Content: Our room was gigantic, beds were comfy, lot of space to put our things and it had a refrigerator. It is located a stones throw from Palantine Hill and the Colosseum and has lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. The owner, Alberta, was very helpful. She recommended great places to eat and gave us directions numerous times. Breakfast consisted of cappucino, juice, brioche, yogurt, jam and cheese was included in the price and was served in-room. The hotel can be tricky to find the first time. It is located on a busy street and the sign is pretty small. There is an elevator but if you have to hoof it, the stairs aren't excessively steep. The hotel will also give a discount for paying in cash and there is a very handy ATM close by. The hotel does not have its own parking but there is a ton of parking available on the street and a few parking garages nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sensitivity
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the Forum and Coliseum, this hotel is perfect. Very neat, tidy, clean and convenient, Hotel Paba features oversized beds and excellent climate control. A small notel with only 7 rooms, travelers are welcomed by Alberta and made to feel at home. Breakfast is served in the room, to get each day started on your schedule. You can walk anywhere in ancient Rome from this charming hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: DAG61
Reviews.Content: Great location and outstanding, caring staff. Made you feel like you were staying with family. Rooms were up to date and clean. A gem within walking distance to all the great sites of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: carolph
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 weeks in Italy which included 4 nights at Hotel Paba in Rome. I had requested a "quiet room" away from the main street and my husband and I were given a spacious suite-like arrangement with large rooms and bathroom. It was spotless. We didn't have a view, but neither were we weren't facing the noisy Via Cavour. Only two blocks from the colosseum, and equi-distant from the metro and busline, it couldn't have been more convenient. As others have mentioned, the real treasure here is Alberta, who manages the place. She was invaluable in getting us reservations to local attractions, made excellent dinner suggestions, and knew how to get to everything. As value for money, this place is unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl319
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and this hotel was great for the price! The location is excellent and we walked everywhere from here. The best croissant was served to us in our room each morning along with delicious coffee or cappucino and orange juice. The small staff were very friendly and helpful. Very close to the ruins and many other sights!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: kelebogile_matt
Reviews.Content: The thing I like most at this hotel is its location, which is extremely convenient to go to both business centers and relaxing spots nearby. The hotel is very clean also. I know for sure that the hotel's managers pay great attention to this. And I'm very pleased when staying here. However, the rooms are a quite small, but I think it's still acceptable. I mean they're not too small. Recommend this hotel to you !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Clean, Great Location and Lovely Owner”
Reviews.Author: jpfnewyork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Paba for one night at the end of April after needing to vacate an apartment we had rented for the few days prior. It was a great choice! Near attractions, very clean and carefully run, we were extremely pleased with having found it for the one night we needed on an extremely busy weekend in Rome. All our interactions with the owner Alberta were professional - from initial emails to arrival - and the breakfast was well appreciated, fresh and delicious. We were a family of 4 and had a large suite with one very large bedroom and an ante-room with a twin sized bed. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: donnasperls
Reviews.Content: Room was very small. However location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidkwchong
Reviews.Content: Our last morning in Rome comprised a morning tour ending near the Colosseum around 1pm. We had to gather our luggage and then catch a train at Termini Station departing shortly thereafter. We chose Hotel Paba given it's proximity to the Colosseum and recommendation in Rick Steve's guide. Worked out well. Alberta stored our luggage in the main foyer and helped us get a cab to the station. She also served us the best croissants we had tasted in our entire 3 weeks in Europe. Paid 100 Euros per night which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paba an excellent choice for family”
Reviews.Author: AndyB2112
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 8 friends and family in Rome for a week, and we stayed at Hotel Paba after reading a review from Rick Steve's, and seeing nothing but glowing reviews on Trip Advisor. the hotel is small, and we took advantage of it being off season to reserve 4 rooms. The hotel is on Via Cavour, a few blocks from the colloseum and the forum, with plenty of dining options close by. Breakfast was delivered to the room daily, and our wonderful hostess was always happy to assist us with questions or problems. The rooms were immaculate and spacious, and decorated with themed movie posters - My wife and I were lucky to be in the Honeymoon room, with the La Dulce Vita poster!! The hotel is a budget hotel, and is very inexpensive by Rome standards, but you couldn't find a more gracious hostess than Alberta, and a wonderfully maintained small business right in the heart of the Eternal City. We would highly reccomend the hotel for couples, families with children, and small groups.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: true_jock
Reviews.Content: I am torn about leaving this review because I hope to return with my husband at some point and don't want the hotel to be full! We have just returned from Rome (February) and felt compelled to comment on our stay. An outstanding visit in every way, myself, my mother and my aunt stayed for 5 nights at Hotel Paba. The hotel owner was most welcoming and always helpful, totally in control of all taxi arrangements - organising transfers to and from the airport - and general advice on eating establishments, buses, directions etc. The rooms are well appointed and immaculate, in fact the hotel itself although surprisingly compact, is stylish and comfortable. The hotel has the perfect location - a 5 minute walk to the Colosseum and to the Vittorio Emanuelle Monment. In fact, this hotel is in the true centre of Rome - everything walkable, lovely area, lots of places to eat - what more can you want? Seriously, we - and that's all 3 of us - cannot recommend this place enough. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Brissie-based
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at PABA. It's centrally located near the Colosseum and the Forum. It's spectacular value and the staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kairetu
Reviews.Content: The service is impeccable. I arrived in Rome at 6am, and my check-in time was 11am. I went to drop my bags in the hotel and Alberta(the hotel owner) pleasantly informed me that my room was ready. In the evening it was pretty cold, she personally went and got me a heater for my room. Breakfast is served in the room and there are some very good guidebooks at the reception which proved very usefull for my sightseeing.The hotel is a walking distance to Colosseum/roman forum and the bus stop just outside the hotel if you want to go to Termini. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate stay in well kept rooms”
Reviews.Author: Normaloraine
Reviews.Content: A bit of a gem on a busy street very close to the Roman ruins and the Coloseum. Alberta gives the second floor (with elevator) a homey feel and personal touch. Our triple was roomy with a bigger shower than usual and a light breakfast served right in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A true jem, great value, Alberta is so helpful”
Reviews.Author: Butcher.T
Reviews.Content: Hotel Paba is a great hotel and Alberta, the owner, is so helpful. The rooms are European is size. They are very clean and very comfortable. We had room 5 which overlooked Via Cavour but the room was still quiet. It is walking distance to the Forum, the Coliseum and many of the sights you want to see. If you want dinner reservations just ask Alberta and she will not only recommend places for you but will also call in the reservation. It is a small hotel on the second floor of a commercial building. There is a breakfast included and Alberta brings it to your room which has a small table and two chairs. We are not big breakfast eaters, so the croissant, yogurt, coffee/tea, juice and rolls were more than enough for us. We had an early pick up to the airport and Alberta was very accommodating in bringing our breakfast early. We used RomeCabs.com and they were very punctual. There are also many travel books in the lobby for your use while staying at Hotel Paba. I would definitely stay there again. You also have free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central and great service”
Reviews.Author: eriksvartbo
Reviews.Content: Family own small hotel with great location. Alberta is really, really nice and everything from restaurant reservations to airport pick-up works impeccable. Quiet hotel, slept like babies and everything very clean, the size of the rooms varies from quite big to quite small. The breakfast is not 5 star, but has all you need. I would definitly go back to Paba if I went to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great price, and charming host.”
Reviews.Author: RedheadedWanderer
Reviews.Content: If you're planning to visit Rome, then you simply MUST stay at Hotel Paba. We selected Hotel Paba after reading lots of reviews, comparing prices, and weighing our options for quite a while... and we chose wisely, indeed! Hotel Paba is run by the delightful Signora Castelli and we received a warm welcome every time we returned to our room after long days of site-seeing. (For those of us who aren't lucky enough to have an Italian grandmother, Signora Castelli provides a glimpse as to how delightful that experience would be.) It's located on the second floor (which means the third floor to those of us who count the ground floor as the first) of a building with a charming, tiny elevator and wide marble stairs. This is not some cookie-cutter hotel... there's only a handful of rooms and you really feel as though you're slipping into Italian life by living in an apartment during your stay. Rome is a pretty grueling town for tourists... so you need a hotel that's both centrally located and comfortable. Hotel Paba is right by the Colosseum and the Roman Forum, making it ideal for tourist activities (and making for a great walk home in the evenings after dinner, with all the ruins lit up!). It's also close to the train station, the Colosseum metro stop, and several bus lines -- you'll be well-situated for all your exploration and transport needs. We visited Italy in August, which means we were prepared for high temperatures, and with Hotel Paba's air conditioning, we were always grateful to collapse into its cool embrace. We were in the "Honeymoon" room, which featured Italian posters of Roman Holiday, To Catch a Thief, and Gone with the Wind. It had windows that opened on to the street, giving you a bird's eye view onto the bustling street below -- but once the windows were closed, the room was wonderfully quiet and serene. The bed was enormous and is perhaps the firmest bed I've ever slept on, but after running around the city all day, we never had any trouble sleeping. Signora Castelli brings breakfast to your room and she's a warm, wonderful woman with all kinds of information about her city. Do yourself a favor and stay at Hotel Paba when you visit Rome. You'll be getting a wonderful deal for your money (without breaking the bank by any means) and you'll come away from your own Roman holiday with charming memories of a unique and sweet establishment. You'll wish that every other hotel you stay at had a Signora Castelli waiting behind the desk to greet you upon your arrival. Hotel Paba really made our trip to Rome a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Best location & service”
Reviews.Author: sflubin
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and 3 kids (6, 9, & 10). We stayed in the Happy Family room - one very large king size bed and two twin beds and a bath - still with plenty of room. Alberta, who owns and runs this fine hotel, was so kind and helpful. The best croissants in ALL of Italy were served with breakfast. The location was fantastic - we walked everywhere! Alberta easily provided my family with internet service (included in your stay), reservations, directions, and recommendations. You cannot get better than this! I highly recommend this hotel if you want amazing service from a personal hotel. This hotel has all the hospitality one should want and need!

Reviews.Title: “Nice large room and bath for European Hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Wise333
Reviews.Content: Very small Hotel located in a building shared with other owners. Hotel room was very large, clean, with a big bed. Bathroom had blow dryer on wall. Room had mini fridge, and A.C. above the door. Room was very quiet for a big city. Owner made Taxi calls for us, and provided wake up phone service, and breakfast delivered to room. At night you have to unlock three doors to enter your room, my husband loved the elevator. If you like quiet rooms with personal service, you will love this place. If you like big showy Hotels-keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean, comfortable small hotel in a perfect location to tour the Colliseum and Forum.”
Reviews.Author: baldy35
Reviews.Content: Touring the key sites of Rome and the Vatican means one is out and about most waking hours, so being conveniently located within walking distance of the Colliseum and the Forum plus the metro and buses; while having clean,comfortable, simple, secure overnight accomodations was key to our selection of the Hotel Paba. We were entirely satisfied with our selection of accommodations without paying an outlandish amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaxMI
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Paba and Alberta! The place was very clean, quite, & in an excellent location! An Alberta - the perfect hostess - she gave us great ideas for dinner and making our connections to other sights and the airport - she was very helpfull! You can't go wrong with this one!!! Jackson, Michigan USA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location with perfect host for perfect price.”
Reviews.Author: Karen255060
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough about Hotel Paba and Alberta. Wonderful location, beautiful room with balcony, warm, clean and comfy, and very quiet even though it is just around the corner from the Colosseo. Alberta was so lovely and always helpful with good advice on eating, travel and bookings. She even bought us breakfast every day. We can highly recommend staying there when in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and precious owner!”
Reviews.Author: StacyCentralFlorida
Reviews.Content: Mrs. Castelli, who is the owner of Hotel Paba, was precious and so helpful. She knew buses, subway lines, places to eat, and was just a delight to talk to. Our room was spotless and she served us breakfast in our room every morning. The hotel is around the corner from the Coloseo and down the street from Victor Emmanuel Monument. It is down the block from both the Cavour or Coloseo Metro stations. There is so much to see and do steps from the hotel. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: HermitageTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've never been to Italy and my friends booked the rooms. It's within walking distance to the collisium, and great sight seeing. The owners were very nice and accomodating. We all had a great time and felt very safe. If I can ever make it back I will absolutely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel with Air Conditioning, Helpful Staff and Great LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: NicholeandScott
Reviews.Content: Alberta was wonderful to us and our guests. She gave wonderful suggestions for meals. This was my 5th time to Rome and my favorite location of all that we've stayed. The bed was comfortable. The room had air conditioning. The noise outside was minimal and you can use the shutters to keep out the light of day if you need to. This couldn't have been a better location for all that we wanted to see and do. Not far from bus or train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent two star hotel. Would recommend and stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: laltin04
Reviews.Content: Great value for comfort, quality near the center of Rome. The staff was so helpful. One of the better two star hotels I have stayed in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, terrific location, great value”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticTwo
Reviews.Content: We found this place on TripAdvisor and were skeptical, but the location and price led us to take a chance. As other reviews identify: amazingly convenient to Roman Forum and Colisseum, as well as transportation. We walked everywhere except to the Vatican. Wifi and large, comfy room. Very helpful staff. Surrounded by little shops and restaurants, including incredible gelateria. Small number of rooms on second (third) floor of unassuming building with offices and apartments. We had balcony onto via Cavour,

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Rome... Location and Wonderful Hosts!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCarter
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about Hotel Paba. First of all it is a total steal for Rome. The location is AMAZING... just a block from the Roman Forum and only a few blocks from the train station. We actually walked from Termini one day. It took about 20 minutes but was all downhill. Also, the two women who work there are so sweet. They spoke very little English but with our broken Italian we got by just fine. They even called our long lost Italian relatives to help set up meeting them. Our room was massive and very clean with a sitting area, walk-in closet and bathroom. Nothing fancy but lots of space. Each morning they would bring breakfast (yogurt, rolls, jams, juice and cappacuino) into our room. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: livinthegdlif
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Alberta was very accommodating. Very firm mattress. Breakfast same daily. GREAT VALUE!! Just book it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay-”
Reviews.Author: DCATraveller
Reviews.Content: Stays at Hotel Paba get better with each one- Stayed back in March 2009 for 4 or 5 nites with a friend-Mrs. Castelli the owner, is a wonderful host of her hotel. Kind and helpful with any request. In the morning I would go to the desk and practice my Italian with her when asking for breakfast-her tips on place to eat are spot on and never had a bad meal, the location can't be beat, you can walk to most everything and with the metro and the bus right there the rest of Rome is at your finger tips- Extremly clean and the beds are wonderful-Had room 6 I believe with the balcony, loved to stand out there in the morning and watch Rome wake up-I would reccommend this wonderful hotel to all-Make sure you to the store right across the street for panni or pizza

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ljr88888
Reviews.Content: I thought getting a hotel room in one of the major cities in the world for 90 euro a night (about $135) was quite a deal. It pays to travel in the off-season! We arrived early in the day after an overnight flight but Signora Castelli had a room ready for us. Very nice-sized room with adequate space in the bathroom also. Via Cavour is a busy, noisy street but the room had double windows plus heavy curtains, so we slept well. Easy walking distance to so many of the major sights. We only rode the Metro to the Vatican and the Galleria Borghese. Metro stop is only 2 blocks away. Many reasonably priced restaurants in the area. Breakfast was a little too sweet for me ... sweet juice, an extremely sweet croissant, cappucino. The bread and yogurt were good, though. On the 2nd morning I asked for "caffe americano" and Sra. Castelli showed me how to use her coffee machine to help myself to a second cup.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: jasmineinma
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here on our honeymoon and it was a great spot. Room was small and cozy, but clean and quaint. The location is perfect for packing in great sightseeing. The proprietor is good-natured. The price is right. She brings a breakfast plate to the room with a pastry, roll, yogurt, and coffee, which was a relaxing way to start the day. We would stay here again if we were in Rome. It was a short walk to the subway, and within an easy walk of the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Central, and Cost Affordable”
Reviews.Author: rogerandlaura2009
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Paba! The Staff was professional, courteous, and helpful. The Rooms were so clean! -"As tidy as a box of chocolates." IAlthough central to everything, the rooms were quiet. We have no reservation in recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: Luvcdays
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, even though it was on a busy street. It reminded us of New York City. Everything was in walking distance, restaurants, shops, historic sites. The staff was great. The bathroom was large. The only complaint would be about the bed. It was hard as a rock and I didn't sleep well all 3 nights. I even took 4 blankets and folded them into quarters and placed them under the bottom sheet, but it was still too hard. Breakfast was definately adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Paba, a great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Krupp60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Paba about a month ago! We were very comfortable with the room. ..much larger than most European rooms and the bathroom a good size as well. It was also very clean, and I am very particular. We were in the Imperial Suite, which had a small cabinet in the bathroom to put your toiletries (nice and convenient). Also, the hotel had a complimentary pair of women's slippers with Hotel Paba written on them. The mattresses were hard and I thought they would be uncomfortable, but they were not. We called every morning when we were ready for breakfast and was brought two croissants, two rolls with butter, jam and cheese and a beverage....we chose cappucino and orange juice. Very filling to start the day. The location was awesome!. We walked to all the main sights, except the Vatican, which we took the subway (very, very crowded and watch your purse, bag and pockets). As mentioned earlier reviews the Coliseum is just around the corner. Do see this, but can't imagine going to Rome and not. We went on three Through Eternity Tours (Roman Forum, Coliseum and Rome Evening Tour), which were very good and informative and we recommend highly. Also, we ordered the free tickets online to see the Pope at the Papal Audience on Wednesday mornings at 10:30 at, of course, St. Peter's Basilica. Our stay in Rome was very memorable and the hotel was great! If and when we return to Rome, we will stay at Hotel Paba!

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: Asd123Gr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Paba is as described in its reviews. We stayed there for 3 nights at the end of October 2009. The room (Room 6) was much better than we expected. Really big (about 25 m2 together with the toilet), especially for Italy standards. The bed was the biggest I had ever seen. Probably it is constituted by two separate beds. The lady at the reception desk was more than helpful while our staying there. Breakfast was nothing special. Little cafes offer whatever you like. We selected a room with balcony, but then we realised that it was noisy at night and at early morning. However, we did not bother as sleeping deeply was not our purpose for our 3-day trip in Rome. Also, since the building is old, there was noise when other room occupants were flashing their toilets or were having a bath. The only significant drawback was that we discovered hair from previous occupants in the bathroom floor and on the bed sheet. However, we did not complain to the Hotel lady, so we cannot accuse her of taking no action. On the contrary, I am sure that if we had compained, she would do her best to satisfy us. The Hotel location is perfect. Most of archaeological sites are within a walking distance. We even walked all the way to Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and Piazza del Popolo in one morning. Via del Boschetto has very good restaurants (especially the one in the corner with Via Nationalle). Metro station (Cavour) is about 5 minutes away. I hope I offered you some help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge rooms - good value!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaKansasCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in October. The location is ideal - about 15 minute walk from the Termini, about 5-10 minute walk from the Colosseum and the Metro stop. Lots of good restaurants nearby. The only downside of the location is that it is on a very busy street, so there is a lot of traffic noise and the last night we were there, we could hear drunken people outside our window, even though it is on the third floor. The room was huge with high ceilings. The bed is a king size and is VERY firm. The room was clean, but the bathroom and shower were very small. Alberta was very nice and brought us breakfast in our room every morning whenever we wanted. We would call the front desk and she would have it to the room within 5 minutes. Overall, great value. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value, location, clean, helpful...has it all”
Reviews.Author: pjbIllinois
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy and spent our last 5 nights at Paba Hotel. A real gem. I agree with all the good reviews. Two things not mentioned that we really enjoyed. The "lift" is one of those old fashioned black iron french kind of lifts that was a joy to ride. It was quieter than a hybrid car! Also the staff at Paba arranged for a cab to take us to the airport at 4:00 a.m.. One of the staff called us at 3:45 (possibly from their home) to tell us they had done so! And the cab ride was only 40 Euro's. We paid 20 Euro's for a cab ride at 6:00 a.m. in Sorrento that was less than a mile! Our only regret is not meeting Alberta as she was in Milan at the time. Perhaps next time as I am sure we would stay here again if we find ourself in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves was right”
Reviews.Author: tolistravelers
Reviews.Content: I'll get the not-so-great out of the way first--hotel rooms are adequate, utilitarian. One of the two rooms had a much nicer bathroom than the other, and like Rick Steves said, the beds are a bit firm. Now onto what is great about the Paba. Location can't be beat. Easy access to get to everything, walking or the Metro, or the buses. Staff--Alberta was away during our stay, but Pina (who speaks little English) and her daughter Flaviola (spelling could be wrong, sorry) (Flaviola speaks English quite well) treated us like family. No request was too difficult to fulfill, and they were wonderful people. We were looking through a brochure of tours for a trip to Tivoli, and came across a cooking class. My Mom and I took it, and what a find. E-mail [--] (he is the chef). After shopping for fresh ingredients at several markets, Fabio takes you to a town called Mezzano Romano (Google it) that in itself is worth the trip alone and you cook fabulous food in his fabulous vacation property. This is worth doing with Fabio if you like to cook. Try to work in a visit to Ostia Antica and Tivoli if you can to see Hadrian's Villa and Villa d'Este. Going on your own to Tivoli is not easy, much easier to take a tour. Loved the staff and how well they took care of us at the Paba.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: JBRV
Reviews.Content: As soon as the reservation was completed I received a confirmation email from the hotel. Over the next few weeks we exchanged multiple emails regarding tour recommendations and restaurants, there were very helpful. I also received an email with several transportation options on how to get from the airport to the hotel. When we arrived we were allowed to check in early. The room was very roomy and clean. The hotel offered complementary internet and they took care of making all our dinner reservations. The hotel was in a great location just a few blocks from the Coliseum and The Forum, and the train station. At the time of check out we were charged less than we were quoted at the original reservation. When we go back to Rome we would definitely stay at Hotel Paba again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, large bedroom, great complementary breakfast and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: char74
Reviews.Content: This hotel only has a few bedrooms and no restaurant but the room we stayed in was very nice. It was clean, very large (especially for European rooms), had a mini refrigerator in the room and included a wonderful breakfast - brought to our room each morning so we didn't even have to get dressed to go eat. The staff was very friendly, helpful and spoke English. But the best part was the location -- The Roman Coliseum was literally right behind the hotel!!! This hotel is within walking distance of several other main attractions and close to the train station, bus stops, etc. There are many restaurants in the area. I would definitely stay here again. It is not your "American 200 room hotel" but that wasn't what we were looking for. We wanted a clean room, close to sites and friendly staff and that is exactly what we got. Very friendly/quaint hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dopee36
Reviews.Content: What a nice little hotel. The room we had was huge! There was even a separate room (in front of the bathroom though) with another single bed in it. The bathroom was large too (for Italy). We had a really nice time there. The hotel is centrally located, so we walked almost everywhere. We did take the train sometimes, but it was probably because we were feeling a little lazy (it was the last city of our whirlwind Italy tour). There's an elevator too, which added to our laziness. The hotelier is really nice. She's extremely helpful and every night, she suggested a different restaurant for us to try. And every one of them was delicious. If you stay here, definitely ask her to recommend places for you to try. You won't be disappointed. Breakfast is served in your room (not very good, I'm afraid). The room is very clean and comfortable. I know there was at least 2 other hotels in the same building, but I would definitely stay with Hotel Paba again instead of the others.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: cc03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Paba for 2 nights in May 2009. Alberta was very welcoming after we arrived from a delayed flight. Our room was small but efficient. It was located right of the reception area which concerned me at first but we had no trouble with noise. Breakfast was served in our room and consisted of hard rolls, yogurt and delicious croissants. Also Alberta gave us a wonderful dinner suggestion. We loved it so much that when we returned to Rome at the end of our trip we made reservations to return to the same restaurant. The best part about this hotel is its location. You are only a few blocks from the Forum and the Coliseum. We walked to all of the major sites from the hotel. Hotel Paba was also only a 20 min walk to the train station. I would stay at Hotel Paba again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cjb11711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days in June 2009. The hotel is located just a minute or 2 from the Colosseum. Alberta is the owner of the hotel and she cares for it very lovingly. She is a great resource in her knowledge of the city. Immediately after we arrived, she made a reservation for us at a great restaurant. The hotel overlooks a busy street (Via Cavour), but our room was in the back of the hotel and was very, very quiet. The beds are huge by European standards though the room itself is an average size. It is very clean and the bathrooms are very modern. It is also very close to the Rome metro, which is great because there are many hotels located in Rome that are far from the subway. Your room rate also includes a simple continental breakfast served in your room. Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value”
Reviews.Author: Kathy50
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Paba. Alberta was kind, gracious and professional. Our room was charming and very, very clean. The breakfast, which was delivered to our room, was nice with a croissant, cappuccino, and some cheese and crackers. Our first morning we overslept (jet lag!) and Alberta brought us our breakfast at 1:00 in the afternoon! Thank you, Alberta, for your TLC of this charming value in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely host, very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: MarieBLondon
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, clean, quirky, charming, and provided us with an extra bed for our son. Offered great advice on local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CTSapphire
Reviews.Content: Hotel Review: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during Easter week. We were greeted by Signora Alberta who runs the hotel. She is a warm person without being over bearing. She provided us with a map and also with some tips on how best to cover the city and best times to get to each location. Breakfast was simple and adequate. Wonderful fresh crossaint, bread with assorted cheeses, yogurt, juice and choice of several hot beverages. This is considered a very substanial breakfast in Italy and was very nice way to start off the day. Great water pressure and nice towels. The location was incredible. We were around the corner from the Colosseum and a short walk from the Termini Station. We walked everywhere. The furtherest point was Vatican City and St. Peter's Basilica which was only about 20 - 25 minutes at a slow pace. But it is part of the experience to stroll the streets and enjoy the views and stop along the way to grab a gelato or snap some photos. Some Rome Tips: If you have the chance, eat in the area of Travestere. This is a wonderful and authentic Roman neighborhood. Fantastic restaurants and the prices are much lower than the other areas. Grab a bottle of wine and relax on the Spanish Steps - and try to ignore the people pushing flowers. Just say no and they will leave you alone. Not a big deal so don't let it ruin your vacation. The audio tours are worth a little extra to get a history and background of the sites (Colosseum, Vatican Museum). Also, keep an eye on the street vendors' prices. They are higher than the actual souveneir shops so look out for price tags on the street vendor items (they will mark them up and then offer you them at half price which is still higher than shops). They are not honest people which is something we figured out by doing some quick comparison shopping. We did not have any issues with pick pockets. There were more tourists than locals so we always felt very safe day and night.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Family Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bibiloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three children (ages 14,12, and 10) stayed at the Paba Hotel for seven days during Spring Break. It's not easy to find a hotel that can accommodate 5 people in one room, especially in Rome, and what a find this was! We had the "Happy Family" room (love the name!) which was spacious enough for all five of us PLUS our five suitcases! The room, described by Rick Steves as "chocolate-box tidy" was spotless, comfortable, and nicely decorated. It has a king-sized bed (big enough for my husband, me, and the 10 year old, and although we could have had an extra bed set up for her, we opted not to and were fine), a twin bed, and then another twin in an adjoining little bedroom (claimed by my 14 year old son). There's free wi-fi in the room, a satellite tv, safe, hotpot for tea and mini-fridge which was perfect for our drinks and snacks. The bathroom was spotless and included a bidet. Although it is located on busy Via Cavour, we had no problem with street noise. The location is perfect...just a short walk from the forum and colosseum and close to sightseeing, bus stops, two metro stations, shops, ristorantes, bars and gelaterias (very important for kids)! The gem in the crown, though, is Signora Alberta Castelli, who runs her hotel efficiently and lovingly. She was very helpful in suggesting transportation, restaurant, itineraries, you name it. We looked forward to seeing her every morning as she brought us our yummy Italian continental breakfast (fresh delicious sweet croissants, rolls/jelly/butter/cheese, hot chocolate, espresso, orange juice and yogurt). She translated a phone call from an Italian family friend for me, gave us tips for our daily outings, helped me with my (bad) Italian and was always gracious and ready to help. All this for a very reasonable price. Oh--and don't be put off by the exterior of the building in which the hotel is housed. Unfortunately the door has been graffiti'd (as we found was the trend in much of Rome) and the trash cans for the block are lined up outside, but it has nothing to do with the quality of or the interior of the building. It is a great area of Rome in which to stay, with lots of sights to see within a short walking distance and everything else easily accessible by bus or metro. As some other reviewers mentioned, the king-sized mattress in our room was very firm, but the only one who cared was my super-picky husband, who traded with the 12 year old and slept in the twin bed for the last few days and was fine. Pina, the very pleasant chamber lady did an excellent job of housekeeping, providing fresh linens and towels daily. I look forward to my next trip to this incredible city and for sure I will stay at the Paba Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the place to stay in Rome. Convenient and Alberta is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDentist09
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel does not look like much. We were actually disappointed when we saw it from the outside. We found the hotel through Rick Steve's book. But once we got in, it was wonderful. Location It is very close to all of the major attractions. We were within walking distance of the roman forum and the colliseum. And to be honest, we walked just about everywhere in Rome. The Trevi Fountain wasn't too far, the Pantheon wasn't bad either. One thing that my wife mentioned is that she wished the better restaurants were closer to Hotel Paba. Most of the restaurants we liked were located more towards the Pantheon side of town. But all in all an excellent location. Service Alberta is top notch. Our daily routine included waking up and letting Alberta know that we were ready for breakfast. She would ask what we would like to drink, I liked the espresso, my wife liked the cappuccino. The breakfast consisted of pastries and yogurt. Simple yet filling. Then we would go over our itenerary with Alberta, she would show us the best streets to walk on and where to visit. Incredibly friendly woman. Rooms The room was cozy. The decor was clean. The TV was small and the showerbox was useful. Other than that we didn't really used the room much. The AC was comfortable and the window view, well it was just a view of the building next door. She had books available to read about Rome, and that's what I would do at night. The room was cute. I do wish we had internet connection at night, so I could catch up on things, so hopefully Alberta will implement that in the future. Value I believe this has got to be one of the better values in Rome. There is a cash discount, so don't forget to ask for it. Overall This is where I will stay if I ever get a chance to go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inexpensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaJoey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 nights in mid January, and couldn't have been happier. I paid only 70 euros a night for a double room, single use. Signora Castelli was a charming hostess, and extremely helpful with arranging daytrips, museum bookings, etc. The room was clean and comfy - and I prefer a harder mattress, honestly. It's better for my back. Graffiti is a part of Rome, and I work daily in NYC, so the neighborhood didn't bother me at all, and I felt safe there. There are tons of restaurants on the street, grocery stores, and 2 internet cafes as well. I was on the street side of the hotel, and for the first night I wished I had earplugs, but afterwards the noise didn't bother me - I was so tired I slept through each night.

Reviews.Title: “Paba was great!”
Reviews.Author: IAS_NY
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Paba is more of a bed and breakfast than a hotel. Very small, clean and homey. The room was a bit too small especially for tourists like us who had way too many suitcases, but the room was comfortable. The beds were a bit hard, but frankly we had such busy days that we slept pretty well every night. We had breakfast in our room at whatever time we asked. Sra Alberta Castelli was a terrific hostess and happy to help in any way. We were in during Christmas week. During the days around Christmas Alberta was away but her assistant could not have been more helpful. She made so many telephone calls for us trying to find a decent place for us to go for New Years that was not too expensive. Only slight negative was that our room was on the main street and at night it was sometimes noisy. That bothered my daughter but not me. GREAT location - close to a metro stop and just 2 blocks from the Roman Forum, on a touristy street where we felt safe at all times. Across the street from a grocery store, post office. Great value. If you want a nice comfortable place with easy a cess to everywhere important in Rome and helpful staff, at a reasonable price, this is the place for you. If you want luxury, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rckt
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 6 nights. We chose the hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and its location. We were extremely pleased with our choice. It is in a great location; within easy walking distance of most of the main tourist sites and it has a bus stop right outside the front door. You can also walk or take a short bus ride to the Termini Station. An added bonus is Senora Alberta. She was extremely helpful in explaining how to get to places, suggesting out of the ordinary places to visit, and in general with everything. We ventured out in the early A.M. several times before breakfast was served, and she made sure we had access to the food before we headed out. Speaking of breakfast, while simple (croissant, pastry, yogurt, etc.) it was delicious! The best breakfasts we had in our 3 week tour of Europe! The rooms are simple yet comfortable. The bathrooms are more than adequate from a size perspective, the shower was very good, and the rooms were quiet despite being on a main street. While I agree that the street entrance leaves something to be desired, we got over that very quickly. Once inside the building, you forget about the entrance and have fun with the elevator. The hotel lobby itself is very nice albeit small. Having been to Rome before, I cannot imagine a better hotel value especially when combined with the terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Great find at the Hotel Paba!”
Reviews.Author: mslgirl
Reviews.Content: We first read about the Hotel Paba in Rick Steve's Guide to Italy and contacted them for our last minute trip. The rates were really reasonable and the reviews on TripAdvisor seemed pretty good. We only spent one night at the hotel because of our flight time, but we were very pleased. Some people complained about finding the hotel - while it does not look like a hotel from the outside and the door has graffiti, it's easy enough to locate the hotel by the address. Once inside and on the second floor, where the hotel is located, it is very clean and looks very nice. The room was quite clean. The TV included many American stations - we even watched college football. I think some reviews said the breakfast wasn't good - while it was simple - just yogurt and some breads - they were fresh and good and it was nice being served in our room. The hotel staff was friendly and knowledgeable. While this is not a '5 star' hotel - for a clean and conveniently located hotel - the Hotel Paba is a gret choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: cornetml
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location! We were able to walk to the hotel from Rome Termini and on a day with good weather, a manageable walk from the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Colusseum, etc. The hotel is small so breakfast is served in the rooms, but the breakfast was great! We had to check out early before the front desk clerk had arrived so the staff showed us where we could help ourselves to breakfast. They wanted to make sure we didn't start our journey on an empty stomach! The room was very clean with a modern bathroom and was spacious enough for two people. Would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: GritsIowa
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel Paba. I choose the Paba based on reviews and comments I had read on Trip Advisor. The staff, Pina and Fabiola were outstanding. They were very solicitous of our needs and comfort. Our room was very spacious and comfortable and the bed was excellent. The breakfast, served at our convenience in our room, was tasty and served promptly after we would call. We really liked having our hotel within a few blocks of the Colosseum, the Forum, and the Piazza Venezia. And we found several excellent sidewalk restaurants with a few blocks of the hotel that were reasonably priced with fine food and service.

Reviews.Title: “I am a travel agent. Senora Alberta is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Jabalu
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent so I should know. I booked this hotel many, many years ago by looking on the internet before there was anything like TripAdvisor. It was my first trip to Italy and the first place we were at out of a 3 week stay. Senora Alberta suggested one of the best restaurants we ate at in Rome. Even though the room was small, it was very clean, the breakfast was one of the best offered, and in a prime location. I have since been back a few times and have booked many a client with her. She knows Rome and it has been a while since we have been back. I miss Italy and her. On one of our other trips she helped us with Sicily as well. This hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nitr0gen
Reviews.Content: It was pretty difficult for us to find the hotel at first. And it seemed that a lot of people we asked had not heard of this place. However, if you just get onto the right street and follow the numbers (266) then it shouldn't be too difficult. There is a small signboard that tells you it's on the 2nd floor. The lift they use is a really small, old fashioned one. Perhaps its common in this part of the world, but it was quite interesting to use. The staff were all very friendly and the rooms were of different sizes. The room we stayed in was pretty small, but I guess for the rating and price, it's pretty ok. Breakfast was croissant, soft roll served with butter and cheese and coffee/tea. Served in your room at no extra charge all the way to 12 noon! The juice in the mini bar comes with the breakfast. There is a mini safe and the TV has cable, though not all english language programs can be switched to english, but you don't go all the way to Italy to watch TV right? The bathroom was small but it was very clean and looked like it was recently renovated. Quite nice decor actually. Anyway, as the other reviews have mentioned, it's close to the Colosseum and Roman Forum. There are some nice restaurants along the street serving very affordable Italian food and the train station is pretty close by too. I'd say that this hotel is perfect for first timers to Rome as its pretty much in the middle of a lot of things, but I'm not too sure if I want to return. The rooms are a bit too small for my liking, though the service is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Should have been a three star!”
Reviews.Author: rligsay
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a minute to offer praise about this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here during one of THE hottest times of the year in Italy. We flew in from San Francisco and we were hot, tired, and so excited! We were looking forward to our first trip to Italy and just wanted to get where we were going without any surprises and without any disappointment. Fortunately, Hotel Paba offered just that! When booking with Hotel Paba 2 months before, I was given a helpful email that had prepared us with information right down to the view from the hotel to across the street. This was helpful as we were walking from the train station (which was about 10 mins) to the hotel. We didn't notice the huge sign next to the door (as we were looking for address numbers) but did see the chinese restaurant and post office they mentioned in the email from accross the street. Once in, the hostess Alberta was friendly and very informative. We felt comfortable asking ridiculous questions. She gave us the honeymoon suite which had its own private bathroom, air conditioning with a remote control, mini-fridge, and private safe. It had a queen size bed that was not, under circumstances, the softest. It honestly looked like a flat board rather than an actual mattress BUT it was suprisingly comfortable. The "queen" size looked like two half-full size beds pushed together but it worked. The next morning she offered us a breakfast that was simple yet filling and very delicious. In fact, my boyfriend searched all over Italy for the juice that came with it (and we actually found it and brought it home). All in all, I had a nice experience at the Hotel Paba. It was very small, about 8 rooms total I think, but homey and very pleasant. It was easy to get to the sights from our hotel. About a 10 min walk from the train station, a 3 minute walk to the colleseum and the roman forum, etc .I highly recommend staying here for the decent price, the location, and the hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: nahlalee
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Great location very close to ancient rome (Colosseum, Roman/Imperial forum, etc.) Close to the metro. We were in room 7, the Director's Cove. It was small but the usual European standard. Don't know what the other rooms are like. Albergo was great. She gave great recommendations for restaurants and for seeing the sights. Remember, she's ALWAYS right. If she says go at 2pm, or go 30 minutes later, do what she says!! We were saved lots of time in lines by listening to her. The room was immaculately clean, loved it. Although you have to register for wifi every 2-6 hours, it is free, albeit a bit slow. (The registering process and slow speed seems routine in Italy.) The free breakfast Albergo provides every morning is more than what you'll get in restaurants/cafes. Italians don't seem to take breakfast very seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Fantastic Hostess”
Reviews.Author: teresavimini
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 day stay directly with the wonderful owner Alberta, and was given a great rate for a double room single use. The room was huge by most Italian hotel standards,and absolutely clean as could be, probably one of the cleanest rooms in Italy that I have ever stayed in ( and I am a frequent visitor to Italy). Daily service of the room was impeccable. There's a huge King bed, which was really comfy, big LCD TV, writing desk, little corner table and chairs, spacious spotlessly clean bathroom, she even provides slippers, nice touch. Breakfast is great, all you need to get you going for a day of walking and sightseeeing in Roma, coffee any way you like it, orange juice, croissants, yummy bread rolls with an assortment of cheeses, jams etc, theres yummy Italian yogurt, and whats great about breakfast, the lovely Alberta serves it in your room whenever you like, you just ring and tell her you are ready for breakfast. The location is superb, Via Cavour, near my fave part of Roma- Monti. I walked and walked everywhere. The view from the window is of all the buzz and activity of Rome, and actually very quiet at night also considering that it is facing the street. I asked for a front room and was wrapt at the view and the bonus of it being so quiet, I slept like a baby. I cannot recommend this hotel and Alberta highly enough. She is a lovely Iady who is of the utmost professionalism. This Hotel is rated 2 stars but really it should be much higher. Do yourself a favour and stay at the hotel Paba.Thankyou Alberta for such a wonderful stay in your hotel.I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jazzfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April, 2008 and couldn't have been happier. Great location. The bed was gigantic and comfortable and we had a small balcony that overlooked the street so we could watch the insane Roman traffic. Alberta couldn't have been more helpful. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place convenient to all the major sights in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: breakoutofthebox911
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at hotel paba for three nights in may of 08... it is on the second floor (small elevator works well) of a large building off of via cavour, a busy street stretching between the forum ruins and termini train station, the main train depot in rome. this hotel is just great... lovingly cared for and owned by alberta castelli, a wonderfully accommodating, friendly and helpful woman. she speaks very good english, knows a number of money saving tips for tours and transportation throughout the city, and is always available for help. she is more than willing to make reservations at the vatican museum and other sites. i would highly reccomend such reservations, as the lines for regular admission into the vatican are hours long, whereas we walked right in with the reservations we had. just a quick tip about transportation... metro is busy but clean, buses are busy but effective. cabs and or taxis are a last resort, and DO NOT use ANY taxis without a meter! we got totally ripped off and learned this lesson the hard way. also, if you are near piazza navona, eat at tre archi, a little hole in the wall just off of via zanardelli 4 doors down on via dei coronari. the best pasta and house vino we had in rome! try the torinelli alla ciociara... absolutely delicious pasta in a tomato cream sauce with mushrooms and bacon : ) yum! anyway, our room at hotel paba, 'the lover's nest', was spacious, clean and quiet. i would request this specific room if possible... it seems to be the farthest from the desk and the quietest. HUGE king bed (a little stiff, but not bad)... plenty of room for luggage and clothes in the armoir. the bathroom was great with a good sized shower stall and a heighth- adjustable shower head... convenient for those of us who are tall (i'm 6'6"). alberta serves a simple but great breakfast of pastries, yogurt, tea, coffee and european crackers anytime you like, all of which is included in your stay. the hotel is a 10 minute walk to the colloseum and a major metro stop. it is not close to the vatican/ st. peter's/piazza navona, but just hop on the metro or the 116 bus and you're there. plenty of restaurants nearby, but DO NOT eat at MASSENZIO down on the corner... way over priced, crummy food served by rude staff. always seek out the places where locals eat... all in all, hotel paba is a great little place to base yourself while exploring rome... friendly, clean and a great value! you will get a lot for a small price in comparison to most of the other hotels in rome... travel safely :)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful clean little hotel perfect for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ruebrezin
Reviews.Content: Two words that cause me to give this hotel a very high rating are: Alberta Castelli. Alberta runs a wonderful, warm 7 room hotel located on the 2nd (Euro) floor of a building on Via Cavour, near the Colisseum. If you are looking for special grand scale amenities, this is not for you. But, if you are looking for a wonderfully clean hotel, with a person who can direct you to the finest (not necessarily expensive) restaurants, help you with reservations at museums, greet you with a friendly smile, serve you breakfast in your room (tables in all rooms); this is definitely the hotel for you. Don’t let the 2-star scare you AT ALL! This is a great little hotel, on a busy-ish street. Because the hotel is only 7 rooms on the 2nd floor and not the entire building, the sign is small next to the door, but if you have the address with you, you or your driver will find it with no problem. Breakfast is croissants, little rolls and yogurt, juice or coffee or tea. Frankly, it was nice to eat and not have to get dressed beforehand! When you left your room, you were ready to head out for the day! I liked that right across from the hotel is a Tabachi, where you can buy train tickets, stamps, post cards, 2 shops where you can buy food, wine, olive oils, etc., and the post office. Just off the street on either side are little winding streets, like alleys, with little shops, restaurants, and gelato. If you head “up” Via Cavour towards the Metro stop and stay to the right, you will find a full service grocery store as well! We walked nearly everywhere and only succumbed to taxis at the end of some days because it was so unseasonably hot and we didn’t have summer clothes with us! The taxis are easy, the drivers are friendly. Alberta suggested reservations if dining after 8 pm which we did on each night. We liked one restaurant so much, we went back twice, something I never do while on holiday. Some people have written here that the beds are hard, but honestly after a long day in Rome, I was perfectly comfortable – and I am not a good sleeper, but I was in Rome! When we arrived Alberta noted that the room she had booked for us, Room 7, would be too small as we had more bags than she realized. She wasted no time in making sure that the next day she would move us into a larger room, Room 4, on Via Cavour side as that room was available the next day. I would definitely stay here again on a next visit to Rome. It is like staying with your mom or grandmom and you treat the room as your own home, it is so clean and welcoming. OH – and there is even a tiny lift so you don’t have to haul your bags up the stairs. The Via Cavour side is a bit noisier than the back side of the hotel, but that didn’t bother us because we like to hear and see activity in a city where we are staying! There is A/C too and I admit that we did use it on a couple of nights when the temperature soared. Alberta is very responsive to your questions if you are planning to book, just email her and you will hear back from her the same day or next. Don’t hesitate to book here! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveldemon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, fairly close to the bus/train station. You are a block away from the Colosseum. Alberta is very nice and helpful. She booked our dinners on a moments notice all but one night. Every restaurant she suggested was fantastic and close to the hotel. The room is large by European standards, with a large bed. It was very clean. The en-suite bath was very clean and quite a good size. There is ample storage and closet space. Our room had air conditioning and a small balcony. The bed had decent linens and nice fluffy pillows. However, it is true that the bed was very firm, I didn't sleep well the first night. However, this has been true of every hotel I stayed at in Italy and my friends who have been to Italy just a few months before, warned me of the same thing and they stayed at other 3 and 4 star hotels. After the first night, I had no trouble sleeping (either because I was so tired or because I became used to it). Just to show that this is somewhat subjective or a matter of taste, my husband had absolutely no problem sleeping and didn't think the bed was too firm. The breakfast is a simple continental style, with a croissant, cappuccino, rolls and spreads, yogurt and orange juice. We had plates and silver. I won't say it was exceptional or great, but the bread was fresh and tasty and it got us through the morning each day, plus it was included in the price and served in our room when we wanted. The decor in the room is pleasant, but not fancy. Overall, the room is a great value for the price in this expensive European city. It is centrally located, has good service and offers all the basic amenities you need (safe, TV, hair dryer, storage, clean bathroom, comfortable). I'd highly recommend it for those traveling on a budget who still want a clean, comfortable, nice room and want good customer service. It isn't for those looking for luxury accommodations. I enjoyed my experience there and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Home While in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cactusjam
Reviews.Content: Alberta was wonderful!! The room was wonderful, quiet, comfortable and spotless. The location cannot be beat. We had a wonderful time. Alberta was more than helpful - she just took care of us. Will stay at Hotel Paba everytime we're in Rome.
